New Records: Richie Berrington and Michael Leask contributed to a 74-run partnership in Scotland's successful chase.
Gerhard Erasmus scored his 11th fifty-plus T20I score with 52 off 31 balls.
Brad Currie took 2 wickets for 16 runs in his four overs, showcasing his medium-pace effectiveness.
Key Match Events: Scotland's stunning run chase to beat Namibia by five wickets.
Richie Berrington finished 47 not out, while Michael Leask scored 35 off 17 balls, turning the chase around.
Namibia's collapse from 49 for 1 to 73 for 4 in the middle overs.
Pre-Game Insights: Gerhard Erasmus won the toss and decided to bat first, despite the unpredictable pitch conditions.
Namibia's batting struggled initially, with only Gerhard Erasmus and Zane Green providing resistance.
Post-Match Reflections: Gerhard Erasmus expressed frustration but acknowledged his contributions weren't enough for a win.
Scotland's victory moved them to the top of Group B, securing their first T20I win over Namibia.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Brad Currie's spin contribution and medium-pace accuracy were pivotal in Scotland's victory.
The match marked Namibia's fourth attempt to beat Scotland in T20I cricket.
